title: Fourth quake hits Afghanistan days after 2,200 killed in deadly temblors
content: Afghanistan has been struck by a magnitude 5 earthquake on Friday night, adding to a series of quakes that hit the nation earlier in the day. This recent seismic activity follows a devastating earthquake on Sunday, which resulted in a death toll exceeding 2,200.

title: Jaishankar to visit UNGA; PM Modi may skip amid Trump factor
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to represent India at the upcoming UN General Assembly in New York. While a slot was reserved for PM Modi, his participation remains uncertain. Sources suggest a meeting with President Trump is unlikely due to ongoing trade talks and recent diplomatic tensions.

title: 'India supports early end of conflict': MEA backs peace push on Ukraine
content: India has reaffirmed its commitment to a swift resolution of the Ukraine conflict and the restoration of lasting peace, expressing support for recent peace initiatives. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar discussed the situation with his Ukrainian counterpart, who sought India's active involvement in peace efforts.

title: Trump to tech CEOs: 'Google had a very good day yesterday'; CEO Sundar Pichai replies
content: Donald Trump held a White House dinner for tech leaders. He congratulated Google's Sundar Pichai on winning an antitrust case. Pichai thanked Trump's administration for constructive dialogue. He praised the US AI action plan. Trump incorrectly blamed Joe Biden for the Google lawsuit. Google and Trump are still in legal discussions over YouTube censorship.

title: Jaishankar to represent India at Brics virtual summit; PM Modi to skip
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India at the Brics virtual summit convened by Brazil, focusing on Trump's tariffs and multilateralism. PM Modi's absence, despite India assuming the Brics presidency next year, signals a balancing act amid trade tensions with the US. The summit occurs amidst US Commerce Secretary's threats of tariffs against India for its Brics participation.

title: Amid a trade war initiated by Trump, a partnership in defense
content: Despite trade tensions initiated by the U.S., India and the U.S. are engaged in Exercise Yudh Abhyas 2025 in Alaska, a large-scale military drill involving 450 Indian Army personnel. The exercise, focused on high-altitude operations and interoperability, underscores the strong defense partnership between the two nations. India emphasizes its commitment to the U.S.

title: White House dinner: Melania Trump warns, ‘Our future is no longer science fiction’
content: President Trump convened tech leaders, including Cook, Zuckerberg, and Pichai, to discuss AI's future. Melania Trump emphasized preparing children for an AI-driven world, advocating for its careful guidance. Tech CEOs lauded the administration's AI Action Plan and investments, with Google and Microsoft pledging significant financial contributions to the U.S. economy.

title: PIL challenges minority quota in HC judge selection
content: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court challenging the collegium system's practice of considering minority community status when recommending candidates for High Court judgeships. The petitioners argue that such quotas based on religion violate the principle of secularism enshrined in the Constitution.

title: From Rs 20 to Rs 100: Coconuts turn luxury in India; prices shoot up amid Onam
content: Across South India, coconut prices have surged from Rs 15-25 to Rs 80-100 due to pandemic-induced supply chain disruptions, climate change impacts, and pest infestations. Neglect of plantations, coupled with increased demand during festivals and tourism, has exacerbated the shortage.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.

title: Meitei, Kuki groups junk Centre's Manipur 'deals'
content: The fragile peace process in Manipur faces setbacks as Meitei and Kuki-Zo groups reject Centre's deals aimed at restoring normalcy. Kuki-Zo groups deny reopening NH2 highway, while Meitei organizations criticize the extension of the SoO agreement with tribal militant outfits, deeming it illegitimate and undermining democratic principles amidst President's rule.

title: Leicester’s Diwali celebrations scaled back; police probe Ganesh Chaturthi procession
content: Leicester's Diwali celebrations are significantly scaled back this year due to public safety concerns raised by a safety advisory group, leading to the cancellation of the Diwali village, stage show, and fireworks. The decision follows a record attendance of 55,000 people last year and concerns about overcrowding and emergency access.

title: 'Misleading': India rejects Navarro's remark; calls it 'inaccurate'
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has strongly refuted US trade advisor Peter Navarro's accusations of India "profiteering" from Russian crude and indirectly supporting the Ukraine war. The MEA emphasized the importance of the India-US strategic partnership, built on shared interests and mutual respect, while dismissing speculation about Trump's attendance at the upcoming Quad summit.

title: Two South Korean mountaineers rescued in Ladakh, one dies
content: In a daring rescue operation, the Indian Army's Fire and Fury Corps airlifted two critically ill South Korean mountaineers from a remote peak near Kongmarula in Ladakh. The challenging night evacuation was executed from an altitude of 17,000 feet, with the climbers transported to SNM Hospital in Leh. Tragically, one of the mountaineers passed away while undergoing treatment.

title: '34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
content: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: Trump admin outlines major reforms for H-1B visas- Here's what you need to know
content: The Trump administration is planning significant H-1B visa program changes, including stricter eligibility and compliance. A proposal slated for December 2025 aims to revise cap exemptions and tighten third-party placement rules. Another rule would prioritize higher-wage earners in visa allocation, potentially impacting Indian beneficiaries and tech companies relying on the program.

title: 'India will say sorry and make a deal': US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick anticipates India will apologize and negotiate with President Trump, drawing parallels to Canada's trade concessions. He cautioned India to cease purchasing Russian oil, withdraw from BRICS, and support the US, or face substantial tariffs. Lutnick emphasized the US's economic dominance and its role as a primary consumer market.

title: Op Sindoor: CDS explains why India used air power; how targets were selected
content: CDS Anil Chauhan stated that India employed air power in Operation Sindoor to dismantle terrorist camps in Bahawalpur and Muridke, as drones and loitering munitions were deemed insufficient to achieve the desired political objectives. This decision followed the Pahalgam terror attack and reflected India's enhanced precision strike capabilities developed after the Balakot operation.

title: 'Highest respect for police force': Ajit Pawar on 'rebuking' women IPS officer
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar faced criticism after a video surfaced showing him allegedly reprimanding a female IPS officer for taking action against illegal soil excavation in Solapur. Pawar clarified that his intention was to maintain calm and not interfere with law enforcement, emphasising his respect for the police force.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad leads, sixth year on top; here’s why
content: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top position in the NIRF management rankings for the sixth consecutive year, maintaining its lead since 2020. The institute consistently excels across key metrics such as teaching, learning and resources, graduation outcomes, and perception. Data from 2016 to 2025 show IIM Ahmedabad’s stable and high performance compared to peer institutions. The 2025 rankings highlight the growing participation of Indian management institutes and the evolving scope of NIRF’s evaluation framework.

title: 'You'll clean it in 2 hours if a dignitary comes': SC raps MCD
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded the MCD for neglecting cleanliness around the "Gumti of Shaikh Ali" monument, questioning their respect for court orders. The court directed the MCD commissioner to hold officers accountable and submit an action plan, emphasizing the need for daily monitoring by a senior official.

title: Duchess of Kent Katharine, oldest living member of Royal Family, dies at 92
content: The Duchess of Kent, Katharine, passed away peacefully at Kensington Palace on Thursday night at the age of 92. Married to Prince Edward, Duke of Kent, in 1961, she became the oldest living Royal Family member after Queen Elizabeth's death. Remembered for her compassion, especially at Wimbledon, and dedication to music and youth welfare, the Royal Family mourns her loss.

title: Tax underpayment: Angela Rayner quits as UK deputy PM; Starmer sends handwritten letter
content: UK Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner resigned on Friday after an inquiry found she failed to meet ethical standards related to a property purchase. Rayner admitted to underpaying tax on an apartment and expressed deep regret for not seeking specialist tax advice. Prime Minister Keir Starmer accepted her resignation, acknowledging her decision to refer herself to the independent adviser.

title: Rs 60 crore 'cheating case': Lookout circular for Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra
content: Mumbai police have issued a Lookout Circular against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra concerning a Rs 60 crore cheating case. The Economic Offences Wing took this action due to the couple's frequent international travel. The case, registered at Juhu police station, alleges they defrauded a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: 'Meri kursi na chheen le': Dhoni was 'scared' of Yuvraj Singh — Yograj Singh
content: Yograj Singh, father of Yuvraj Singh, has reignited controversy by accusing Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni of being backstabbers who feared his son's talent. He claimed Sachin Tendulkar was Yuvraj's only true friend, alleging others felt threatened by Yuvraj's potential to usurp their positions in the team. Yograj has previously asserted that Yuvraj was forced into early retirement.

title: 'Took out 67 glass pieces': Met fatal accident, battled cancer - know who she is
content: Mahima Chaudhry, the Bollywood star of the 90s known for hits like 'Pardes,' faced a career-threatening accident when a truck collided with her car, leaving her with severe facial injuries. Fearing its impact on her career, she initially kept the incident private.

title: Trump’s 'high-IQ' tech dinner: Indian-origin CEOs shine; AI and US investments highlighted
content: At a White House dinner hosted by President Trump, five Indian-origin tech executives, including Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella, were recognized for their significant influence in the US tech sector. These leaders, representing companies like Google, Microsoft, and Micron Technology, highlighted their contributions to AI and innovation.

title: Mid-air scare: AI Express' Delhi-Indore flight issues PAN-PAN call over engine fault
content: An Air India Express flight from Delhi to Indore experienced an engine problem mid-air. The pilot sent a 'PAN-PAN' alert. This signaled a non-critical emergency. The plane landed safely in Indore with a slight delay. Airport authorities took precautions. All 161 passengers and crew are safe. The aircraft landed at Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport.

title: Aishwarya & Abhishek shielded Aaradhya from media: Pap reveals more
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan's daughter, Aaradhya, was a subject of immense public curiosity after her birth in 2011. Paparazzo Manav Manglani recounted the frenzy to capture her first photo, revealing the lengths photographers went to, given Aishwarya's initial protectiveness.

title: GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
content: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

title: Unbelievable! Tickets at Rs 100 - Women's WC sets record with lowest prices in history
content: The ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 is set to break barriers with ticket prices starting at a record low of Rs 100. An exclusive pre-sale window is already open until September 8. Shreya Ghoshal will headline the opening ceremony in Guwahati on September 30, performing the tournament anthem “Bring it Home.

title: From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida’s luxury farmhouses
content: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

title: Watch: Army's daring night evacuation in Ladakh; 2 South Korean nationals rescued
content: The Indian Army swiftly responded to a distress call on September 4th, launching a rescue operation to evacuate two South Korean nationals stranded at the Kongmarula Pass in Ladakh. Helicopters were deployed within 15 minutes of receiving the request, successfully airlifting the individuals from the high-altitude location around 9:15 pm.

title: NIRF rankings 2025: Hindu, Miranda House remain best two colleges of India
content: Delhi University (DU) continues its dominance in the NIRF 2025 rankings, securing top positions with 32 colleges on the list. Hindu College and Miranda House retain their top spots, while DU achieves its best-ever fifth position among universities. Other Delhi institutions like JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia also shine, with AIIMS Delhi leading in medical and dental categories.

title: Who is Karol G? Colombian superstar shines; chiefs vs chargers halftime show
content: The National Football League's 2025 season expands to Brazil. Sao Paulo will host a game between Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Chargers. Colombian singer Karol G will perform at the halftime show. The performance will stream live on YouTube. Ana Castela will sing the Brazilian national anthem. Kamasi Washington will deliver the U.S. anthem.

title: US Open: 'Goldfish' Amanda Anisimova goes from rock bottom to cusp of success
content: Amanda Anisimova has learned to forget, reset, and fight again. Just 54 days after her crushing 0-6, 0-6 Wimbledon final loss, the 24-year-old American is back on the biggest stage — this time at the US Open. With belief, grit, and booming winners, she now stands one match away from her first Grand Slam crown, just 61 miles from where she was born.

title: 'Locked himself in bathroom': This actor recalls school bullying; shares story
content: Hrithik Roshan, celebrated for his acting, dance, and looks, overcame a difficult childhood marked by stuttering and a spinal problem that doctors said would prevent him from becoming an actor. He faced immense challenges, including locking himself in a bathroom to practice speaking without stammering.

title: ‘Will be legitimate targets’: Vladimir Putin warns of direct attacks in Ukraine
content: President Putin warned that any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be considered legitimate targets, following pledges of postwar security guarantees including an international force. He argued such deployments wouldn't ensure lasting peace, citing growing military ties as a conflict root cause. Macron criticized Russia's troop movements despite ceasefire talks. Recent large-scale Russian attacks targeted Western Ukraine.

title: Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
content: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

title: ‘Illegitimate targeting’: US puts sanctions on Palestinian rights groups
content: The U.S. sanctioned three Palestinian human rights organizations for allegedly instigating the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation into Israel, according to the Treasury Department. Secretary Rubio stated the groups targeted Israeli nationals without consent, prompting the action. The ICC's later arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders over war crimes allegations further fueled the controversy.

title: Exclusive | From Rs 1 coins to defeating Divya Deshmukh: Abhimanyu Puranik’s journey
content: Divya Deshmukh, after her Women's World Cup victory, revealed her mentors, Csaba Balogh and Abhimanyu Puranik. At the Grand Swiss 2025, Puranik, who had just enjoyed a Disneyland vacation, defeated his protégé, Divya. Puranik, a Mumbai-born Punekar, started chess at five and praised Divya's amazing mentality and potential for future dominance in Indian chess.

title: Sky suspend Reese for 'detrimental' comments
content: Angel Reese has been suspended by the Chicago Sky for the first half of Sunday's matchup against the Las Vegas Aces for comments she made that were "detrimental to the team."

title: OKC rookie Sorber out for season with torn ACL
content: Thunder rookie big man Thomas Sorber tore the ACL in his right knee and will miss the 2025-26 season, the team announced.

title: Astros' Trammell won't face discipline for bat
content: Astros outfielder Taylor Trammell is facing no discipline from Major League Baseball after umpires confiscated his two-color bat when New York Yankees manager Aaron Boone asked for it to be checked following a double.

title: Suárez banned 6 games for spitting at rival staffer
content: Inter Miami striker Luis Suárez has been given a six-game suspension for spitting at a Seattle Sounders staff member following Sunday's Leagues Cup final.

title: 49ers' McCaffrey doesn't practice, but feels 'great'
content: 49ers running back Christian McCaffrey did not practice on Friday with a calf issue that popped up during Thursday's workout, but he once again made it clear he believes he will be on the field Sunday against the Seahawks.

title: Alcaraz dominates Djokovic to make US Open final
content: Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Novak Djokovic 6-4, 7-6 (4), 6-2 at the US Open to reach his third consecutive Grand Slam final.

title: Parsons 'limited' in practice, questionable vs. Lions
content: Micah Parsons made it through all four practices -- on a limited basis -- in his first week with the Packers and was officially listed as questionable for Sunday's regular-season opener against the Lions.

title: Mets send Senga to Triple-A: 'Right thing to do'
content: The Mets optioned Kodai Senga to Triple-A after the right-hander posted a 6.56 ERA over his past eight starts.

title: ⚾ Ranking MLB cores: The teams with most talent
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: 'He changed for the better of the game': How Jim Harbaugh has evolved as Chargers coach
content: From San Francisco to Ann Arbor to Los Angeles, Jim Harbaugh's coaching style has changed through the years.

title: NFL's youngest head coach hopes to follow in his father's winning footsteps
content: A head coach at 37 and a former QB himself, Kellen Moore aims to get New Orleans back to the postseason.

title: Connelly: 28 games that could make Week 2 very interesting
content: Get set for two big brands trying to look the part in a unique helmet game, some big tests for Big Ten hopefuls and the Group of 5's biggest weekend.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: 30 years later, remembering Ripken's record-setting streak
content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: To call plays or not to call plays ... that's the question for many top head coaches
content: Coaches like Mike Norvell and Ryan Day were known for calling plays. If they need or want to stop, things get interesting.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

title: Key matchups, fantasy intel and predictions for Week 1's remaining 15 games
content: Here's everything you need to know for Week 1 NFL games. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: Sabalenka vs. Anisimova: Who will win the US Open title?
content: No. 1 Sabalenka will take on No. 8 Anisimova in the US Open final Saturday. Who will prevail? It's not as straightforward as it seems on paper.

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: NCAA, NHL rule change reactions, Schaefer ready for Islanders
content: The incoming first-year class offered its take on several significant topics ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: 'I got one more ring from it': Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: Rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: Top prospects at every position
content: Who are the best players at every position? Our analysts give their top-fives, plus their combined overall top-10 ranking for the 2026 class.

title: NEXON brings back real-world Icons Match alongside EA FC events
content: NEXON will be running another real-world Icons match featuring players like Eden Hazard, Wayne Rooney and Ronaldinho, with connected in-game events in EA FC 26.

title: James Madison's icy white look headlines best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: James Madison will look to make a statement on the road against Louisville wearing a slick all-white look.

title: Chargers powder blue, Chiefs' traditional look in Brazil top NFL Week 1 threads
content: Here's a look at the Week 1 uniforms for all 32 NFL teams, led by the Saints debuting their gold uniforms.

title: Why Daniel Levy has left Tottenham after 25 years as chairman
content: Levy, 63, has established himself as one of the most respected executives in soccer, but Thursday saw him stepping down in a seismic move. How did it happen, and what will his legacy look like?

title: 50 most expensive transfers of summer window, ranked by true cost: Isak isn't No. 1
content: There's how much a transfer costs, and then there's what a club can afford to pay. We've ranked the *actual* 50 most expensive transfers of the 2025 summer window.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: "I Don't Think We Have...": Trump Responds To His "Lost India" Remark
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday responded to his Truth Social post claiming the US has "lost India and Russia to China," saying he does not believe that has happened.

title: Trump Signs Order Renaming Pentagon As 'Department Of War'
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Friday renaming the Department of Defense as the Department of War  a long-telegraphed move aimed at projecting American military toughness around the globe.

title: "India Can't Handle Truth": Trump's Aide Renews Attacks Over Russian Oil
content: Peter Navarro, Senior Counsellor for Trade and Manufacturing for US President Donald Trump, has yet again accused India of profiteering from Russian oil in his latest slew of remarks, alongside alleging that India's tariffs cost "Americans' jobs".

title: "Very Unfair": Trump Threatens EU Tariffs Over $3.4 Billion Google Antitrust Fine
content: US President Donald Trump lashed out at the European Union Friday for slapping Google with an "unfair" $3.47 billion antitrust fine, threatening retaliatory tariffs if the bloc does not repeal the measure.

title: Trump To Attend US Open Men's Final On Sunday: White House
content: President Donald Trump will attend the men's final of the US Open tennis championship in New York on Sunday, a White House official said, marking the latest in a series of visits to major sporting events.

title: 'India Supports Early End To Ukraine Conflict': Foreign Ministry
content: India on Friday said it supports an early end to the Ukraine conflict and return of an enduring peace in the region.

title: 22 River Monitoring Stations Record Severe Flood Situation
content: The Central Water Commission on Friday warned of widespread flooding across several states, with 22 river monitoring stations reporting 'severe flood' situation and 23 others 'above normal' water levels.

title: Flood Victims In Delhi Battle Fever, Infections
content: As families from the inundated Yamuna belt are shifted to relief camps, a steady flow of flood-affected people are now rushing to doctors with fevers, rashes, and fungal infections.

title: Man Starts Moving Amid Funeral Preparations; Was Declared "Brain Dead"
content: A man who was declared "brain dead" in Nashik started moving and coughing while preparations were on for his final rites, his relatives alleged on Friday.

title: 'If Dignitary Comes...': Top Court To Civic Body On Cleaning Lodhi Era Monument
content: "You will clean it in two hours if a dignitary is coming", the Supreme Court has said as it slammed the MCD for its inaction in maintaining cleanliness around the Lodhi-era monument "Gumti of Shaikh Ali" in Delhi.

title: Video: Egg Thrown At Imran Khan's Sister Outside Pakistan Jail, 2 Arrested
content: In a horrible incident Aleema Khanum, sister of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, had an egg thrown at her outside Adiala Jail in Rawalpindi.

title: Health Emergency In Andhra Village After 'Mysterious Illness' Kills 20
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Friday declared a health emergency in a village in Guntur district and sent high-level medical teams to investigate after a 'mysterious illness' claimed the lives of at least 20 people in two months.

title: BJP Vs Trinamool As Kolkata Gives Controversial Film 'Bengal Files' A Miss
content: The hugely controversial film "Bengal Files" was released today amid a huge political row between the state's Opposition BJP and the ruling Trinamool Congress.

title: 21,000 Cops Deployed In Mumbai For Ganesh Immersions, AI To Manage Routes
content: More than 21,000 police personnel will be deployed in Mumbai to maintain law and order during idol immersions on Anant Chaturdashi, the tenth and final day of the Ganesh festival, officials said on Friday.

title: Wife Living In Adultery Not Entitled To Maintenance: Delhi Court
content: Rejecting a divorced woman's plea seeking financial assistance, a Delhi court has observed that a wife living in adultery is not entitled to any maintenance from her husband.

title: Glacier Melting In Arunachal Pradesh Sparks Fears Of Lake Outburst Floods
content: Rapid melting of glaciers in the Eastern Himalayas in Arunachal Pradesh has raised concerns, with a record 1.5 metre melting of ice measured by scientists using vertical stakes

title: 2 Arrested For Selling Rotten Meat In J&K's Ganderbal, Cases Filed In Several Districts
content: Two persons were arrested for allegedly selling rotten meat and expired eatables in Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district on Friday, police said.

title: Kuki Body Clarifies On "Free Movement"; Manipur Top Official Says Will Honour Agreement
content: Manipur Chief Secretary Puneet Kumar Goel on Friday said the renegotiated suspension of operations (SoO) agreement signed with Kuki, Zomi and Hmar insurgent groups will be honoured.

title: 'No Reduction In Overall Cargo Shipments From India': Union Minister
content: Amid concerns over the impact of a 50 per cent US tariff on Indian products, Union Ports Shipping and Waterways Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Friday claimed that there has been no reduction in overall cargo shipments from India.

title: Siddaramaiah Downplays Demand For Anti-Terror Agency's Probe In Dharmasthala Case
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday downplayed calls for a National Investigation Agency (NIA) probe into allegations of multiple murders, rapes and burials in Dharmasthala

title: Stone pelting near Ujjain over ‘love-jihad’ tableau in Ganpati procession
content: Police said that the situation was peaceful but adequate force has been deployed as a preventive measure

title: Meghalaya CM seeks Delhi road named after father Purno Sangma
content: Conrad K. Sangma also discussed with Home Minister Amit Shah the implementation of the inner-line permit in the Meghalaya

title: Mob vandalises National Emblem at Hazratbal Shrine
content: Darakshan Andrabi, chairperson of J&K Waqf Board, sought police action against the protesters and accused the National Conference of inciting the people

title: Rajasthan facing ‘alarming’ rise in cancer cases; Jaipur worst hit: study
content: The average cancer incidence in the State is estimated at 134.57 cases per one lakh population, which is significantly above India’s national average of 113 cases

title: 14,000 contractual workers of National Health Mission quit as stir enters 19th day in Chhattisgarh
content: Protest poses two-pronged challenge to BJP govt., with health services severely hit, Oppn. criticising handling of the issue; four of 10 demands accepted, says govt. official; issue notifications: protesters

title: Passenger holding areas planned at Secunderabad station ahead of festive rush
content: To ease congestion on the platforms and foot overbridges, two holding areas will be set up on Platform 1 with a combined capacity of 1,500 passengers

title: PCB data declares Hyderabad ‘quiet’, residents decry late-night din
content: On August 31, the daytime decibel level recorded at Paradise was 37.71 dB. This is quieter than an office or library that will have the sound level of 40 dB

title: Chief Minister Naidu urges teachers to bring in innovation to help today’s tech-savvy students
content: Chief Minister asks teachers to embrace technology and use AI tools and quantum computing to guide students, says educators cannot afford to lag behind their own students or even their children and grandchildren in terms of technology

title: Congress moves High Court against expanded size of Chhattisgarh Cabinet, calls it unconstitutional
content: The induction of three Ministers following the expansion on August 20 takes the size of the Cabinet to 14 in the 90-member Assembly, which breaches the Constitutional limit of 15%, the civil writ petition filed by the party said

title: Caste census: Panel preps up with 60 questions to be posed to 7 crore people
content: The caste list is expected to be have over 1,800 community names in the State at the start of the survey on Septermber 22

title: Caught in trade war, Andhra’s aquaculture faces collapse
content: Over the past four decades, the export-oriented aquaculture in Andhra Pradesh offered sustenance to hundreds of thousands of people from across the country and shored up rural economy. The steep hike in U.S. tariff on Indian goods, however, has cast a shadow of uncertainty over the sector and the lives it supports, writes Rajulapudi Srinivas

title: Rattling the nuts and bolts in Ludhiana
content: Punjab’s industrial hub – known for engineering tools, textiles, and basmati rice exports – braces for the U.S. tariff fallout. While the ripple effects are not immediate, early signs such as reduced working hours and cost-cutting in factories point to an imminent impact on production and livelihoods across industrial sectors. Vikas Vasudeva finds that business owners are currently holding off on layoffs despite an order slump

title: Meitei group rejects Suspension of Operations pact with Kuki-Zo groups in Manipur
content: COCOMI, one of the largest Meitei civil society groups in Manipur, says the decision taken by Centre “reflects an undemocratic and hegemonic imposition upon the indigenous people and its elected representatives of Manipur”

title: New technology, innovation conclave to ‘replace’ Science Congress to be held in November
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to attend the inauguration of ESTIC; the Indian Science Congress has not been held after 2023 following a spat between DST and ISCA

title: New book on Operation Sindoor is benchmark for future military strategy, says Army Chief
content: Book by retired Lt. Gen. K.J.S. Dhillon is a tribute to Army’s courage and professionalism, says Gen. Dwivedi and adds Operation Sindoor reflected India’s resolve, strategic clarity, whole-of-nation approach

title: 'Woke': Trump renames Pentagon as ‘department of war’; GOP hails move
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Collateral consequences of Ukraine conflict, including fuel price, affecting Global South: India tells UNGA
content: Underscoring that the wholehearted participation and commitment of all stakeholders is critical for lasting peace, India told the UN General Assembly that it welcomes the ‘recent positive developments’ in this direction

title: Northern States get reprieve from rain but grapple with aftermath of floods
content: Water levels in dams and rivers drop as the rain has taken a break while the IMD has predicted light to moderate rainfall at most to many places over the country’s northwest and west region during the next seven days. Many residential areas and farmland are still underwater

title: Watch: Modi, Xi, Putin get closer | Photo-op, or warning to the West?
content: From Trump tariffs to the Tianjin troika - does the Modi-Xi-Putin pow-wow mean more than a photo-op? After the SCO meet and China’s military parade, can India’s eastern outreach force a rethink in the West on sanctions?

title: Bruhat, Vishala and many more: Writers offer alternatives to ‘greater’
content: Karnataka govt. faced backlash from the Opposition and sparked a social media debate for using the English word ‘Greater’ instead of a Kannada word while christening Greater Bengaluru Authority

title: Baramulla MP Engineer Rashid attacked in Tihar: Awami Ittehad Party
content: According to the AIP spokesman, Rashid spoke to his counsel, Advocate Javeed Hubbi, about “harassment” inside the jail

title: Crops on 14.44 lakh hectares damaged by heavy rain, says Maharashtra government
content: Excessive monsoon showers between August 15-20 have hit 191 talukas, damaging kharif crops in 654 revenue circles, says State Agriculture Minister

title: Comparing Bihar with beedi is shameful, the BJP says
content: ‘An attack is being made directly on the identity of Bihar and its people,’ former Union Minister and BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said of the since deleted post by the Congress’s Kerala unit

title: A.P. CM orders urgent steps to find cause of Turakapalem deaths, take up remedial action
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to treat it as a health emergency and send special medical teams to the village to screen every resident and prepare a health profile to tackle the scourge

title: Congress in Kerala apologises after ‘Beedis and Bihar’ post backfires
content: In an attempt to pull off a sardonic wordplay depicting the proposed lower tax on beedis as a bid to entice rural voters, the INC@Kerala wrote on X: “Bidis and Bihar start with B. Cannot be considered sin anymore”

title: Teachers are architects of society, says Chittoor Collector
content: He urges teachers to guide underprivileged children, instil values, and protect students from negative influences during Teachers’ Day celebrations

title: Vidya Parirakshana Cycle Yatra highlights students’ issues in Prakasam
content: The eight-day yatra, covering 380 km across the district, draws attention to delayed fee reimbursements, high hostel charges, and challenges faced by students under the new National Education Policy

title: GST relief, subsidies, and innovations boost Andhra Pradesh’s livestock and poultry sector, says official
content: ‘Government initiatives are helping farmers increase milk and meat production, expand poultry operations, and strengthen biosecurity measures across the State’

title: CM welcomes revamped GST rates, but says the benefits should reach common man
content: If the benefits fail to reach the common man, the blame will rest squarely on the Union government: Siddaramaiah

title: Recent recusals in Supreme Court, HC, tribunal send mixed signals on transparency
content: No formal rules govern recusals by judges; SC judge M.M. Sundresh recently exited bail plea case  without providing any reason; bucking the trend, NCLAT judge, M.P. HC judge opted for transparency

title: Five workers missing after water release from dam floods Gujarat hydropower plant
content: The police say there were 15 workers on maintenance duty inside a 60-ft deep well in the plant when water was released from the Kadana dam upstream. While 10 of them managed to escape, five people are yet to be traced.

title: EAGLE chief warns students against drug use
content: He highlights cases of students caught in drug-related offences and urges youth to stay vigilant and report peddlers via WhatsApp

title: Jaishankar to join Brazil-led BRICS virtual summit on Trump tariffs: MEA
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend summit called by Brazil President Lula; the meet is likely to irk Washington that views the BRICS as “anti-American”

title: Himachal CM slams BJP leaders for not helping disaster-hit residents
content: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu says State government has requested Centre to provide ‘one bigha’ of forest land to each affected family to help them resettle in safer locations

title: Kuppam police take action against false social media posts on Krishna waters
content: Officials say HNSS canals are supplying water as scheduled, dismissing disruption reports as baseless

title: Modi government has made a mockery of MGNREGA by chronically underfunding it: Jairam Ramesh
content: On the 20th anniversary of MGNREGA, the Congress general secretary says the scheme has been underfunded for the last 11 years and the budget has not been hiked for the last three years despite high inflation. This latest crisis is not an aberration but a reflection of a larger attempt by the government to throttle the scheme, he says

title: IT Minister Lokesh seeks Prime Minister Modi’s support for development of Andhra Pradesh
content: Expressing gratitude for approving an ASIP semiconductor unit in the State, he seeks the Centre’s help in tapping the potential of IT, Electronics and Communications sector

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. denies purchasing new helicopter for Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: With the security agencies flagging concerns over the existing one developing technical glitches often, an advanced Airbus H160 helicopter has been taken on lease to not only cut travel time but also save costs, say CMO officials

title: India unveils roadmap to strengthen nuclear deterrence, drone warfare capabilities
content: The document titled Technology Perspective and Capability Roadmap (TPCR-2025), a 15-year blueprint for military preparedness, highlights measures to ensure credible nuclear deterrence

title: Congress is ‘home of fake Gandhis’, says BJP A.P. president
content: Calling for regular forums that enable leaders to understand public opinion and shape better policies, P.V.N. Madhav says, every problem has a solution when people and leaders discuss it together

title: Fantasy baseball news: Yankees may lack Jazz versus Blue Jays
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the remaining 14 contests are all evening affairs . a few spots may see some light showers, but no game is in serious danger of not being played .

title: Banner day for Eagles as champs hold off Cowboys in wild one
content: defensive tackle was ejected for spitting on Dallas Cowboys quarterback dak Prescott . the rivalry game remained as intense from start to lightning-delayed finish . both defenses took some time to stabilize before eventually finding their footing .

title: US Open rescue pup wins over Sabalenka, finds home with Muhammad
content: defending champion Aryna Sabalenka is a 20-something-year-old who fell in love with a rescue dog . she met a very good boy named Wilson and asked her fans and followers for help . he is going home with another tennis champion on friday .

title: Solak predicts stat leaders: No. 1 candidates in five categories
content: there are plenty of markets for season leaders in all sorts of statistical categories . there are markets for leaders in passing yards, rushing yards and receiving yards . the touchdown categories get very noisy, but there are historical trends we can look at .

title: The 'invisible fight' that has inspired The Fighting Nerds' viral success
content: caio Borralho defeats jared Cannonier in main event . the 45-year-old is the founder and head coach of the MMA gym . a victory could earn each fighter a title shot in his respective division .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs consider move for Man City's Nathan Aké
content: Josh Sargent confirms speculation that he was close to a move away from Norwich City with both Sunderland and Wolfsburg linked . Cristiano Ronaldo wants former Manchester United teammate Mason Greenwood to join al Nassr as Saudi Arabian clubs look to strengthen .

title: Can you import an entire offense? OU hopes so with John Mateer, Ben Arbuckle
content: new: n.c. coach bill Belichick stepped in with a substantial financial figure of its own . new: bill belichick, whose Tar Heels lodged a sizable bid, is stepping in with its own financial figure . he'll face no. 14 Michigan on tuesday in a game against the u.s.

title: Which countries can book a place at the World Cup this week?
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're a long way from discovering the list of 45 nations who will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the full field of 48 . japan were the very first country to qualify on March 20 .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks and Shadow Report for Week 1
content: Mike Clay explains why he is optimistic about jerome Ford's fantasy outlook in week 1 . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: A desire to be a global brand: Why Chiefs have embraced Brazil
content: dozens of fans arrived hours before the Chiefs walked through the terminal . many screamed when Kelce surprised a group of women by high-fiving each of them . the crowd cheered, recorded videos and chanted the last names of quarterback Patrick Mahomes .

title: 'There's a lot of hate': These games define the Mizzou-Kansas rivalry
content: the second home game of the season will go to a commercial break before the fourth quarter begins . it has become customary that the Mizzou fans in attendance will lob F-bombs in unison at their biggest rival . the rivalry resumed in 2021, with Kansas winning the first three games .
